title.value: Переваримость питательных веществ и баланс азота при введении в рацион молодняка свиней ферментных добавок
Nutrient digestibility and nitrogen balance when using enzyme supplements in the diet of young pigs

journal.title: Animal Agriculture and Veterinary Medicine : quaterly research and practice journal

person.name: Mokhova, E.V., Belarus State Academy of Agriculture, Gorki (Belarus)

abstract.value: The effect of enzyme supplements on nutrient digestibility as well as nitrogen, calcium and phosphorus balance in stores has been studied. Mixed pig feed with enzyme supplements and phytase seems to have increased assimilation of virtually all dietary nutrients and to have improved nitrogen balance. Better results were obtained when

was supplemented in the dose of 100 g/t. Dry matter digestibility was higher than that in the control group by 3.56 percentage points, crude fiber digestibility - by 4.03 p.p., digestibility of nitrogen-free extractive substances - by 3.8 p.p.,that of crude fat - by 3.48, and crude protein digestibility - by 2.23 p.p. The level of daily nitrogen retention in a pig body exceeded that of the control by 10.7%, and the level of calcium retention - by 5.1%.When using phytase enzyme supplement, nutrient digestibility and nitrogen balance are higher than those in the control group, but to a smaller extent than in the case of using
